meanings.definition: A satirical or lampooning piece of writing or speech.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's pasquinades about politics had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper published a pasquinade mocking the mayor's latest decision.
meanings.sent3: The clever pasquinades in the play added a humorous touch to the storyline.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp pasquinades cut through the seriousness of the political debate.
meanings.sent5: The author's pasquinades were so witty that they became the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To write or create a pasquinade.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pasquinade the politician's speech to highlight its absurdity.
meanings.sent2: The students were asked to pasquinade a famous poem for their assignment.
meanings.sent3: He loves to pasquinade his friends' silly antics in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The comedian pasquinaded the latest celebrity scandal in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent5: They planned to pasquinade the company's outdated policies in a humorous video.
